intro: Psychotria barcellana, commonly known as the Caribbean psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Caribbean region, including parts of Cuba, Hispaniola, and Jamaica. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are rich in alkaloids. Psychotria barcellana is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and rocky crevices.
